page.title: 12REDBOURN COMMON
page.content: {Redbourn Common}is a very large open space in the middle of the village.It links the High Street with the old village centre at{Church End}in the West of the village. It is a very important part of the village life because it is in constant use for all sorts of things. At the beginning of this century the {Common}was used for the grazing of{ {Sheep}and{Goats},people hung their washing there to dry and there was even a{Golf Course}on the Common. Now in 1985 the Common is used every week for{Cricket Matches}.Also there is a{Play Ground}for the children.In the summer people come down to the Common with a picnic. The{Scouts}and{Round Tablers,} organize fetes and carnivals especially in the summer.Also a{Fun {Fair}comes at least twice a year.
